SEARCH
Module it.polimi.ingsw.am16
Package it.polimi.ingsw.am16.client.view.gui.controllers.screens

Class PlayScreenController

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.am16.client.view.gui.controllers.screens.PlayScreenController
public class PlayScreenController extends Object
Controller for the main play screen. Handles all the main game events and interactions.

      public PlayScreenController()

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize()
      Initializes the screen, registering all event handlers, adding buttons to switch play areas for all the players, preparing the points board, slots for common cards, for common objectives, for the player's personal objective and the hand.

    • setPlayers

      private void setPlayers(List<String> usernames)
      Sets the players for this game. This is a definitive list that will not be changed in the future. This method creates all the necessary elements to handle the players, including the buttons to switch play areas.
      Parameters:
      usernames - A list containing the username of each player in the game.

    • setGameState

      private void setGameState(GameState state)
      Sets the new state of the game. If the game is ending, switches to the end screen.
      Parameters:
      state - The new state of the game.

    • showError

      public void showError(ErrorEvent errorEvent)
      Sets up and shows the error popup whenever an error occurs.
      Parameters:
      errorEvent - the fired error event.

    • setPlayerColor

      private void setPlayerColor(String username, PlayerColor color)
      Sets the color of the given player, creating a colored peg and adding it to the points board. This method also adds the colored peg to the peg slot.
      Parameters:
      username - The username of the player whose color is being set.
      color - The player's color.

    • setStartOrder

      private void setStartOrder(List<String> startOrder)
      Sets the order in which players will play during this game. This method orders the player buttons in the correct order.
      Parameters:
      startOrder - The order in which players will play during this game.

    • addBlackPeg

      private void addBlackPeg()
      Adds the black peg to the starting player next to their standard colored peg.

    • turn

      private void turn(String username)
      Initiates the given player's turn. Adds a white halo the player's button.
      If it's this client's user's turn, a series of further actions is performed:
      • plays a sound to alert the player that they have to play;
      • enables drag and drop functionality on the cards.
      Parameters:
      username - The username of the player whose turn has just started.

    • updateInfoTable

      private void updateInfoTable(String username, Map<ResourceType,Integer> resourceCounts, Map<ObjectType,Integer> objectCounts)
      Updates the given player's info table with new values.
      Parameters:
      username - The username of the player whose resource and object counts are being updated.
      resourceCounts - A map containing the amount of each resource currently visible on the player's play area.
      objectCounts - A map containing the amount of each object currently visible on the player's play area.

    • showChatFilter

      public void showChatFilter(javafx.event.ActionEvent ignored)
      Shows the chat filter box, allowing players to send both private and public messages.

    • sendChatMessage

      private void sendChatMessage()
      Sends a chat message.

    • setCommonObjectives

      private void setCommonObjectives(ObjectiveCard[] commonObjectives)
      Sets the common objectives for this game, showing them in the correct slot.
      Parameters:
      commonObjectives - The common objectives for this game.

    • setHand

      private void setHand(List<PlayableCard> hand)
      Sets this client's player's hand.
      Parameters:
      hand - The cards in the player's hand.

    • addCardToHand

      private void addCardToHand(PlayableCard card)
      Adds a card to this client's player's hand.
      Parameters:
      card - The card to be added.

    • removeCardFromHand

      private void removeCardFromHand(PlayableCard card)
      Removes the given card from this client's player's hand.
      Parameters:
      card - The card to remove.

    • setOtherHand

      private void setOtherHand(String username, List<RestrictedCard> hand)
      Sets another player's restricted view of their hand.
      Parameters:
      username - The username of the player whose restricted hand is being set.
      hand - The player's restricted hand.

    • addCardToOtherHand

      private void addCardToOtherHand(String username, RestrictedCard card)
      Adds a restricted card to another player's hand.
      Parameters:
      username - The username of the player whose hand this card should be added to.
      card - The card to be added.

    • removeCardFromOtherHand

      private void removeCardFromOtherHand(String username, RestrictedCard card)
      Removes a restricted card from another player's hand.
      Parameters:
      username - The username of the player whose hand this card should be removed from.
      card - The card to be removed.

    • promptStarterChoice

      private void promptStarterChoice(StarterCard starterCard)
      Opens a popup to allow the player to choose the side on which to play their starter card.
      Parameters:
      starterCard - The starter card that was assigned to the player.

    • choosingColors

      private void choosingColors()
      Opens a popup to allow the player to choose their color. By default, this popup tells the player to wait.

    • promptColorChoice

      private void promptColorChoice(List<PlayerColor> colorChoices)
      Shows the color options on the previously opened color popup. If choosingColors() methods wasn't called previously, this method will call it automatically.
      Parameters:
      colorChoices - The options from which the player can choose their color.

    • promptObjectiveChoice

      private void promptObjectiveChoice(List<ObjectiveCard> possiblePersonalObjectives)
      Opens a popup from which the player can choose their personal objective.
      Parameters:
      possiblePersonalObjectives - The options from which the player can pick their personal objective.

    • setPersonalObjective

      private void setPersonalObjective(ObjectiveCard personalObjective)
      Sets the player's personal objective and closes the choice popup.
      Parameters:
      personalObjective - The player's personal objective.

    • setPlayArea

      private void setPlayArea(String username, List<Position> placementOrder, Map<Position,BoardCard> field, Map<BoardCard,SideType> activeSides, Set<Position> legalPositions, Set<Position> illegalPositions, Map<ResourceType,Integer> resourceCounts, Map<ObjectType,Integer> objectCounts)
      Sets the given player's starter card and creates their play area, and initializes the info table.
      This method also closes the starter card choice popup if the given username if this client's player's username.
      Parameters:
      username - The username of the player whose new play area is being given.
      placementOrder - The order in which card were placed in this play area.
      field - A map containing the position of each card in the play area.
      activeSides - The side on which each card was played in this play area.
      legalPositions - The set of positions where a card can be placed.
      illegalPositions - The set of positions where a card cannot be placed.
      resourceCounts - A map containing the amount of each resource currently visible on the player's play area.
      objectCounts - A map containing the amount of each object currently visible on the player's play area.

    • playCard

      private void playCard(String username, BoardCard card, SideType side, Position pos, Set<Position> addedLegalPositions, Set<Position> removedLegalPositions, Map<ResourceType,Integer> resourceCounts, Map<ObjectType,Integer> objectCounts)
      Plays a card on the given player's play area and adds them to their grid.
      Parameters:
      username - The username of the player who played the card.
      card - The card that was played.
      side - The side on which the card was played.
      pos - The position where the card was played.
      addedLegalPositions - The set of new positions where a card can be placed.
      removedLegalPositions - The set of positions where a card can no longer be placed.
      resourceCounts - A map containing the new amount of each resource currently visible on the player's play area.
      objectCounts - A map containing the amount of each object currently visible on the player's play area.

    • setDeckTopType

      private void setDeckTopType(PlayableCardType whichDeck, ResourceType deckTopType)
      Sets and shows the type of card currently on top of the given deck.
      Parameters:
      whichDeck - The type of deck.
      deckTopType - The type of card on top of the specified deck.

    • setCommonCards

      private void setCommonCards(PlayableCard[] resourceCards, PlayableCard[] goldCards)
      Sets and shows the common cards from which the players can draw.
      Parameters:
      resourceCards - The resource cards from which the players can draw from.
      goldCards - The gold cards from which the players can draw from.

    • setGamePoints

      private void setGamePoints(String username, int gamePoints)
      Sets the amount of game points earned by the given player and updates the points table.
      Parameters:
      username - The username of the player whose game points are being given.
      gamePoints - The amount of game points earned by the player.

    • setObjectivePoints

      private void setObjectivePoints(String username, int objectivePoints)

    • notifyDontDraw

      private void notifyDontDraw()
      Disables draws for subsequent turns. Plays a sound to alert the player that the last round has begun.

    • signalDeadLock

      private void signalDeadLock(String username)
      Tells the user that the given player is in a deadlock situation and their turn is skipped.
      Parameters:
      username - The username of the player who is in a deadlock situation.

    • signalGameSuspension

      private void signalGameSuspension(String whoDisconnected)
      Tells the player that the given player has disconnected and the game is being suspended as a result.
      Parameters:
      whoDisconnected - The username of the player who disconnected.

    • signalGameDeletion

      private void signalGameDeletion(String whoDisconnected)
      Tells the player that the given player has disconnected and the game is being deleted as a result.
      Parameters:
      whoDisconnected - The username of the player who disconnected.

    • receiveMessages

      private void receiveMessages(List<ChatMessage> messages)
      Adds the given messages to the chat.
      Parameters:
      messages - The newly received messages.

    • setPlayerButtonActions

      private void setPlayerButtonActions(String username)
      Adds event listeners to the player buttons to show other player's basic info, like their hand, and to allow the switch to see their play area.
      Parameters:
      username - The username of the player whose player button should be updated with event listeners.

    • switchToOtherPlayer

      private void switchToOtherPlayer(String username)
      Switches the currently visible screen to the given player's screen. This method changes the visible play area, info table, hand and personal objective. This method also adds a colored halo around the screen.
      Parameters:
      username - The username of the player whose screen should be shown.

    • resetPlayer

      private void resetPlayer()
      Resets the screen to this client's player's and removes any halos around the screen.

    • switchToPlayArea

      private void switchToPlayArea(String username)
      Switches the currently visible play area to the given player's.
      Parameters:
      username - The username of the player whose play area should be shown.

    • switchToHand

      private void switchToHand(String username)
      Switches the visible hand to the requested player's.
      Parameters:
      username - The username of the player whose hand should be shown.

    • applyHalo

      private void applyHalo(PlayerColor color)
      Applies a colored halo around the screen.
      Parameters:
      color - The color of the halo to apply. If null, a black halo will be applied.

    • removeHalo

      private void removeHalo()
      Removes any halos around the screen.

    • enableDraw

      private void enableDraw(boolean enabled)
      Enables or disables the common cards and decks so that the player can draw a card.
      Parameters:
      enabled - Whether the common cards and decks should be enabled.

    • leave

      private void leave()
      Leaves the game.

    • showRules

      public void showRules()
      Shows the rules popup.

    • registerEvents

      private void registerEvents()
      Registers all the main event handlers for this screen, including buttons and events fired by incoming messages from the server.

    • inHierarchy

      private static boolean inHierarchy(javafx.scene.Node node, javafx.scene.Node potentialHierarchyElement)
      Checks whether the given node contains another node between its descendants.
      Parameters:
      node - The "father" node.
      potentialHierarchyElement - A potential descendant of the father node.
      Returns:
      Whether the given node is a descendant of the father node.
